##Oerview##
Following R chunk take data file with lots of taxonomy information (characters) and OTU data (site-by-species matrix) and turns it into a list. 

## 1) SETUP
### A. Retrieve and Set Your Working Directory
```{r, results = 'hide'}
rm(list = ls())
getwd()
setwd("~/GitHub/QuantitativeBiodiversity/Assignments/Beta")
```

## 2) LOAD DATA
```{r}
soilbac.full <- read.table("./data/soilbacfull.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, row.names = 1)
```

##3) CREATE LIST
```{r}
tax <- data.frame(soilbac.full[,1:5]) #assign taxonomy
otu <- data.frame(soilbac.full[,6:28]) #assign site-by-species matrix
soilbac.list <- list(tax, otu) # create list
names(soilbac.list) <- c("tax","otu") # name objects in list
str(soilbac.list, max.level = 1) # look at structure of list
```

##4) SAVE LIST 
```{r}
write.table(soilbac.list, sep = "\t", file = "data/soilbac.list.txt")
```
